alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 12:35PM PDT until August 24 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 232 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 232 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1233 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms occurring across areas between Big Bear City to just east of Lake Arrowhead. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Big Bear City, Lucerne Valley, Big Bear Lake, Running Springs, Seven Oaks, Hwy 18 Between Running Springs And Big Bear, Angelus Oaks, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit, Hwy 18 Between Baldwin Lake And Lucerne Valley and Baldwin Lake. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
